That‚Äôs where true efficiency and profitability lie.

Headline: Product Manager | AI Features | Ex-Leadsquared, Betterplace | BITS Pilani
Comment: CAC and LTV could both be flawed for a business. There can be cases where I buy T-shirts from Nobero, once a year, I spend Rs 1k for it. So, they just gett Rs 1k over a period of 12-24 months, but it doesn't mean I do not trust them. I trust them fully, but sometimes I need variety and might order bamboo T-shirts. Sometimes, CAC is not even related to LTV, and LTV is not related to AOV. A high AOV does not translate to LTV always. Blanket statements like these most often than not miss a lot of nuances which are critical to the type of business you are in.

Headline: Founder, Future Foundry| Building Next-Gen Wellness & Lifestyle Brands | Ex-Scootsy (Acquired by Swiggy)
Comment:
Breaking even on customer acquisition cost (CAC) with the first order is a solid starting point ‚Äî but it‚Äôs not where the real business is built. Without a strong backend system in place (email flows, WhatsApp retargeting, retention loops), repeat purchases won‚Äôt happen at scale.
And without repeat behavior, you can‚Äôt build contribution margin 2 (CM2) or 3 (CM3). Sustainable unit economics come from turning a one-time buyer into a returning customer ‚Äî and that happens after the first sale, not during it.

Headline: Fractional CMO | Scaling Brands | Business Advisory
Comment:
Long term repeat purchases are important as it improves conversions/brings down CACs. 

But for bootstrapped D2C brands it's important to be profitable on each sale by keeping CAC within margins.

LTV is yet to be proved and may not happen as expected in the future  -  CAC is here and now.

Final point if you are a D2C brand, the cost or repeat customers is not ZERO. Maybe so for a Swiggy; not for a fashion D2C brand.

Comment:
Well that's how Bottomline and Topline should really looks like. 
Though I agree completely with what you wrote Rishabh Mariwala , I want to add here that continued Profit is a function of increasing Topline and reducing Bottomline. 
So increasing AOV per customer automatically reduces CAC through clustering and that's the smartest way to move ahead with increasing LTV over time through smart Sales techniques and ofcourse #trust . 

This inherently is called #brandbuilding

#retail #D2C #sales
